formatted_address: 72, Jalan Eko Botani 3/2, 79100 Iskandar Puteri, Johor Darul Ta'zim, Malaysia
name: Matam AlBarakah Bistro

reviews.text:
Located in a good business area. Nice ambience and friendly staffs.
Given 3 thick menus (Arabic cuisine , Indian cuisine & Drinks) gives you the confusion to decide what dish to order and what to drink.
Food were good.
Mutton Kabsah 7/10
Hyderabadi chicken biryani 7/10
Chicken shawarma 7/10
Kunafe 8/10
Hazelnut latte 8/10

Mat’am Al Barakah offers an exceptional experience from the moment you walk in. The atmosphere is elegant and peaceful, perfect for both special occasions and quiet dinners. The food was beautifully presented and full of flavor—every dish showed attention to detail and quality.

The highlight of our visit was their special zurbiya rice—perfectly cooked, fragrant, and packed with flavor. We also loved the tandoori chai, which was served piping hot with a smoky, rich taste. It’s a must-try for tea lovers!

The service was outstanding: polite, attentive, and always professional. The staff truly made us feel welcome and valued.

If you’re looking for a fine dining restaurant that delivers both luxury and warmth, Mat’am Al Barakah is the place to go.
Highly recommended—we’ll definitely be coming back!
Food is good. Place is musty. Service is bad because the can’t speak any other language beside Indon

Been here for Iftar. Great menu as it covers both arab and north indian dishes. The kashmiri naan and mutton masala were of excellent taste.

Due to no space had to sit at the l
Outside open area. Wonderful service.
Good ambiance and food quite reasonably priced and quality was good.
